title: 111_hr5973
content: The "Offshore Lease Fairness Act" increases revenue sharing with states for leases within 3 miles of the coast line. It amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to provide states with 50% of revenues for leases entered into after the Act's enactment date. Increased revenue sharing with states for leases beyond 3 miles of the coast line. The amendment defines new outer continental shelf revenues as sums received by the US from leases entered into after a specified period for areas on the outer Continental Shelf. The term 'new outer Continental Shelf revenues' excludes certain revenues and amounts from leases entered into between December 20, 2006, and the date of enactment of the Offshore Lease Fairness Act. The Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act of 2006 is amended to include new sections regarding the disposition of Outer Continental Shelf revenues. The Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act of 2006 is amended to include new sections regarding the disposition of Outer Continental Shelf revenues, specifically in SEC. 106. The Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act of 2006 is amended to include new sections regarding the disposition of Outer Continental Shelf revenues. For fiscal year 2010 and onwards, 50% of new revenues will go to the general fund of the Treasury, and the other 50% will be deposited in a special account for coastal States. The allocation among coastal States will follow rules similar to those for Gulf producing States. The Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act of 2006 is amended to allocate new outer Continental Shelf revenues from leases in specific ocean regions to coastal States bordering those regions. SEC. 107. TIMING AND ADMINISTRATION OF DISPOSITION OF REVENUES. Timing and administration of depositing amounts under sections 105(a)(2) and 106(a)(2) for a fiscal year are specified for the subsequent fiscal year. The amounts made available shall not require further appropriation, remain available until expended, and are in addition to any amounts appropriated under other laws. Amendments are made to section 105 of the Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act of 2006. The Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act of 2006 is amended by striking subsections (c) and (e) and redesignating subsections (d) and (f) as subsections (c) and (d), respectively.
